citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
An adult female Shetland Sheepdog “Nilla” (microchip 985112011766695) has severe dental disease. A heavy buildup of
thick brown material was seen covering most of the teeth on both sides. The gums were bright red and severely swollen
along the gumlines on both sides of the mouth with the redness and swelling worse on the right side. Additionally,
discharge is seen on the right side at the base of a lower molar. Heavy buildup on the teeth with redness, swelling and
discharge can be signs of dental problems and can cause infection, pain, and discomfort to the animal.
Failure to provide veterinary care when needed can result in prolonged suffering and worsening of the condition of the
animal. Licensees must ensure that they establish and maintain programs of adequate veterinary care, including the use
of appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries. When animals are identified with
injuries or illness, they must seek care by their veterinarian to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases. Correct by
ensuring that the animal listed above is examined and treated by a licensed veterinarian, also ensure all animals are
provided with adequate veterinary care.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2)  Direct Repeat
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
An adult female Shetland Sheepdog “Nilla” (microchip 985112011766695) has severe dental disease. A heavy buildup of 
thick brown material was seen covering most of the teeth on both sides. The gums were bright red and severely swollen 
along the gumlines on both sides of the mouth with the redness and swelling worse on the right side. Additionally, 
discharge is seen on the right side at the base of a lower molar. Heavy buildup on the teeth with redness, swelling and 
discharge can be signs of dental problems and can cause infection, pain, and discomfort to the animal. 
 
Failure to provide veterinary care when needed can result in prolonged suffering and worsening of the condition of the 
animal. Licensees must ensure that they establish and maintain programs of adequate veterinary care, including the use 
of appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries. When animals are identified with 
injuries or illness, they must seek care by their veterinarian to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases. Correct by 
ensuring that the animal listed above is examined and treated by a licensed veterinarian, also ensure all animals are 
provided with adequate veterinary care. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.

n
